III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The worker reportedly kidnapped the child and sent threatening
messages to the parent after the worker was fired. The parent
reported the worker for engaging in sexual activity with the child’s
father and reportedly the worker kidnapped the parent’s child
because of it. No one will tell the parent where the child is.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Program Officer was interviewed by phone on 7/23/2024 and
reported Parent A has other youths in care through a different
county who are being case managed by that county’s local office.
Program Officer stated Youth A remained with Parent A after his
birth in April but was removed from her care on 7/2/2024 and
placed in foster care. Program Officer stated Youth A was placed
with Caregiver 1 who lived in the same apartment building as
Parent A. On 7/16/2024, Foster Care Worker 1 arrived at
Caregiver 1’s home for a home visit and found Parent A alone with
Youth A. Program Officer stated Parent A was ordered to have
supervised contact only and was not to be left alone with Youth A.
Caregiver 1 returned to the home at which time she reported to
Foster Care Worker 1 she was used as a babysitter, but Youth A
actually lived with Parent A. Parent A told Foster Care Worker 1
the removal order was fraudulent, so she was allowed to have
Youth A. Foster Care Worker 1 called MDHHS who advised her to
call the local police for assistance to remove Youth A from Parent
A. When the police arrived, they would not assist and left because
the worker only had a virtual copy of the court order on her phone
and not a physical copy. Parent A then left the apartment with
Youth A who she placed on her lap in her car. An agency
supervisor brought a printed copy of the court order to Foster Care
Worker 1 who then called the police a second time. The police
began to look for Parent A and Youth A. Within 2 hours, Parent A
called the police to report she was at Burger King with Youth A. At
approximately 5:00pm, Program Officer met Foster Care Worker 1
at the Burger King. Program Officer spoke to Parent A and
2

provided Parent A with the court order after which Parent A gave
Youth A to Program Officer. Program Officer stated Parent A was
very calm and seemed to understand. Program Officer then
bought Parent A dinner and explained that Youth A would be
brought to the hospital for an examination then would be placed in
a licensed foster home. Program Officer asked Parent A for
information about any relatives who might provide care for Youth
A at which time Parent A provided information for her aunt.
Program Officer reported the agency staff have been attempting to
contact that aunt but have not received any response.
Program Officer stated, since Youth A was removed from her
care, Parent A has been escalating, stating the removal court
order is fraudulent because an MDHHS worker from the county
where her other children are in foster care told her it was. Program
Officer reached out to that county’s’ MDHHS supervisor who had
no knowledge of a worker telling Parent A the order was
fraudulent. Program Officer stated Parent A sends at least 4
emails a day to different people involved in Youth A’s case with
allegations against agency staff and requesting to no longer work
with this agency. Program Officer stated Parent A’s services are
voluntary at this point and she has not been compliant and has not
signed any releases for the agency staff to obtain her medical or
mental health records.
Program Officer stated there was a Team Decision Making (TDM)
meeting yesterday to discuss Youth A’s placement change during
which Program Officer again told Parent A that Youth A was
placed in a licensed foster home, and he was doing well and being
well cared for. The TDM had to be ended early due to Parent A’s
not participating in the discussion, rather Parent A began accusing
Foster Care Worker 1 of having a sexual relationship with Youth
A’s father and stated she did not want to work with the agency.
Program Officer stated she had no reason to believe Foster Care
Worker 1 had a sexual relationship with Youth A’s father. She
stated Foster Care Worker 1 is no longer with the agency, but that
had nothing to do with Youth A’s case and was related to
administrative concerns.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed by phone on 7/24/2024
and stated Youth A was removed from Parent A’s care and placed
with Caregiver 1 by MDHHS on 7/2/2023 after which the agency
was assigned the case on 7/3/2024. Foster Care Supervisor
reiterated the events of 7/16/2024 as described by Program
Officer. She stated she was not present on the scene on
7/16/2024, but she was on the phone with Foster Care Worker 1
3

and the police. She reported, after Parent A called the police to let
them know where she was with Youth A, Youth A was brought to
urgent care for an exam then was placed in a licensed foster
home. Foster Care Supervisor reported Parent A is now denying
she was ever alone with Youth A and that she was “set up.”
During yesterday’s TDM, she denied leaving her apartment with
Youth A on her lap in her car. Foster Care Supervisor reported
Parent A had not yet been adjudicated for Youth A, and there is a
pending termination of parental rights petition for her other
children, so she does not yet have a treatment plan through the
agency.
Foster Care Supervisor reported Parent A sends multiple emails a
day with different allegations including that the removal court order
is fraudulent because it does not have a raised seal. Foster Care
Supervisor stated she has no idea where Parent A got the idea
that Foster Care Worker 1 was having a sexual relationship with
Youth A’s father and Foster Care Worker has no reason to believe
that to be true. Foster Care Supervisor stated Foster Care Worker
1 is no longer with the agency, but that was unrelated to Youth A’s
case and was based on documentation issues.
Foster Care Supervisor reported Foster Care Worker 2 has been
assigned to Youth A’s case for 5 days and has not had any
contact with Parent A other than during yesterday’s TDM;
therefore, she has no information about the allegations made by
Parent A.
Parent A was interviewed by phone on 7/24/2024. Parent A
stated she was at Caregiver 1’s home on 7/16/2024 for a visit with
Youth A and fell asleep. When she woke up, Caregiver 1 was not
there, so she was alone with Youth A. Parent A stated she called
Caregiver 1 who told her Foster Care Worker 1 said she could
leave Parent A alone with Youth A, which Parent A told her was
not true. Foster Care Worker 1 then arrived to take Youth A, but
the police told her she had to get off Parent A’s property.
Caregiver 1 arrived home and saw the police, so she handed
Parent A the baby back and left again. Parent A stated she knew
she was not supposed to be alone with the baby, so she went to
Burger King to be in a public place. Parent A called MDHHS then
911 to surrender Youth A. When asked why she referred to the
removal as a kidnapping, Parent A stated the agency had no
jurisdiction. When asked why she believed Youth A is missing,
she stated no one will tell her where Youth A is placed. She stated
she knows she can’t know the name and location of the foster
home, but her aunt is trying to get ahold of the agency and hasn’t
4

received a response, so her family doesn’t know where Youth A is
either.
Parent A stated, after Youth A was taken from her, Foster Care
Worker 1 sent her threatening text messages which she will
provide. Parent A reported the agency will not respond to any of
her emails. When informed emails between Parent A and the
agency staff have been reviewed, she stated they might email her,
but her concerns about Youth A and Foster Care Worker 1 aren’t
addressed. She stated the agency is retaliating against her for
saying Foster Care Worker 1 is having a sexual relationship with
her child’s father. Parent A reported Foster Care Worker 1
admitted to having a sexual relationship with Youth A’s father,
which Parent A recorded and will provide; however, she later sent
an email indicating the recording had “autodeleted” so she no
longer has it. She stated she forwarded the recording to Foster
Care Supervisor, but she never got a response. She stated she
told Foster Care Supervisor and Program Officer she wasn’t
comfortable working with Foster Care Worker 1, but they did not
respond. Parent A stated Foster Care Worker 1 made false
accusations by writing her treatment plan that Parent A thinks
everyone is out to get her.
DOCUMENT REVIEW
Incident Report - 7/17/2024 Child Placing Agency Incident
Report (MDHHS-6082) completed by Foster Care Supervisor and
Program Officer document the following:
• 12:00PM Foster Care Worker 1 arrived at Caregiver 1’s
home for a scheduled home visit, but she was not home
• Foster Care Worker called Caregiver 1 who told her she
had left Youth A with Parent A, who lives next door to
Caregiver 1
• Parent A did not answer door or phone
• Foster Care Worker 1 called the police for assistance
removing Youth A from Parent A
• 1:00PM police arrived and got Parent A to open the door.
Foster Care Worker observed her holding Youth A
• Parent A stated the removal court order was fraudulent, so
the police stated it was a civil matter and left
• Caregiver 1 admitted to Youth A living with Parent A and
Caregiver 1 being utilized as a babysitter
• 1:51PM an agency supervisor called the police to explain
the validity of the court order. They reported they would
send a car back out
5

• 3:17pm the supervisor placed another call to the police as
no one had yet arrived
• 3:36pm Parent A left her apartment and drove away in her
car with Youth A on her lap
• 3:56pm police arrived at Parent A’s apartment and called
Parent A who again stated the court order was fraudulent
and she wouldn’t reveal her location after which a missing
person’s report was filed
• 5:45pm Parent A called the police and reported she was at
Burger King
• Program Officer and an agency Supervisor went to Burger
King and picked up Youth A
• 7:09pm Youth A was taken to urgent care for an exam, no
concerns were noted
• 8:54pm Youth A was taken to his new foster home
placement
Court Orders
• 7/2/2024 Order to Take Child into Protective Custody and
Place documenting the Referee’s order to place Youth A to
MDHHS for care and supervision
• 7/3/2024 Order Continuing Preliminary Hearing
documenting continuation to allow notice to required Indian
Child Welfare Act notifications and ordering Youth A
continued under the care and supervision of DHHS with
supervised visitation for Parent A
• 7/10/2024 Request and Order for Review of Referee
Recommendation submitted by Parent A alleging Youth A
was removed from her care due to CPS harassment and a
CPS worker not providing information in her other children’s
case. It was ordered the referee’s recommendations were
affirmed and the Judge would not have arrived as a
different ruling than the Referee
Emails
• 7/16/24 Parent A to Foster Care Supervisor stating the
court order she was given was invalid because it didn’t
have a seal from the court. She also stated she was not
alone with Youth A and that Foster Care Worker 1 was
retaliating because Parent A mentioned she’d been
sleeping with Youth A’s father
6

• 7/17/2024 Parent A to Program Officer stating she gave
Parent A a fraudulent court order when she kidnapped her
child the previous day
• 7/18/24 Parent A to Program Officer with a screenshot of a
portion of a text message exchange she reported just
having occurred
• Parent A also provided screen shots of this text exchange
of 7/18/24 via email; however, she provided the full string of
the exchange which started with Parent A stating she has
been depressed since her baby was placed with a stranger
to which Foster Care Worker 1 responded with a request
for Parent A to stop texting her phone. Parent A sent three
texts in a row insulting Foster Care Worker 1, accusing her
of making false accusations and “snatching” Parent A’s
baby, followed by “you just called me a bitch and said you
were going to pull up and beat me ass. I have a witness to
what you just said. How foul” to which Foster Care Worker
1 responded “I know what I said. Stop texting this phone
I’m no longer your case worker! Weirdo!”
• 7/19/2024 Program Officer to Parent A requesting Parent A
stop communicating with Foster Care Worker 1 because
Foster Care Worker 1 was no longer assigned to the case,
as they discussed the day before. Program Officer wrote
they would discuss Parent A’s concerns at a TDM the
following Monday
Audio Recording
• Parent A emailed an attached recording between her and
police officers during which she was requesting copies of
police reports and claiming the removal court order
presented by agency staff was fraudulent. The officers
attempted to explain the validity of the court order and told
her to follow up with the court for further confirmation.
Personnel File
• 7/18/2024 Corrective Action Form documenting discussions
regarding Foster Care Worker 1’s falsification of documents
related to home visits as well as mileage logs. The form
also documented a supervisory note was previously
completed with Foster Care Worker 1 in April 2024 for
missing a foster home visit. The form stated Foster Care
Worker 1 submitted a resignation letter at the end of the
7/17/2024 meeting
• 7/17/2024 resignation letter from Foster Care Worker
7

Placement Record
• Youth A placed with Caregiver 1 7/2/204-7/16/2024
• Youth A placed with Caregiver 2 7/16/2024-current
Case Assignment History
• Foster Care Worker 1 4/15/2024-7/18/2024
• Foster Care Worker 2 7/18/2024-current
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Foster Care Worker 1
demonstrated responsible character and suitability to meet the
needs of children and families served by the agency when
removing Youth A from Parent A in compliance with a court order
and placing Youth A in a licensed foster home.
While Parent A received an inappropriate text message from
Foster Care Worker 1, that message was received when Parent A
continued to send Foster Care Worker 1 text messages after she
was made aware Foster Care Worker 1 no longer worked for the
agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
